title: Rest Day - Stretching & Foam Roller Only (Pav Bryan's Stretching Video)
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to allow the body to recover from training

Just recovery today:

Focus on:

Hydration, feeding, stretching, foam roller, et al. Feel free to follow this stretching video -> (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=spB4VwprTIw)

Checkout this guide on improving your recovery: https://spokes.fit/technique-tactics/how-to-improve-your-recovery/

title: PLEASE READ THIS BEFORE STARTING
description: Please download and read the attached guide before starting your training plan.

title: "I Hate Pav" Intervals - Session 1
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to improve maximal power output, mainly targeting the anaerobic system

20 minute warm-up

8x (15 sec hard 45 sec easy)
4x (1 min hard 2 min easy)
1x (10 min FTP)

During the hard part your RPE should be 8 or above, max means maximum sustainable for the time, use workout builder as a guide only. Cadence of a normal amount so gear appropriately. During the recovery parts reduce all resistance and spin legs. Don’t worry about Zones during this session.

10 minute cool-down

Here's a Spokes guide on building mental toughness: https://spokes.fit/mental-fitness/be-stronger-mentally/

steps.name: Warm up
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes session! 

This is an intense session, make sure you make the most of this warm-up. You might want to add some higher intensity efforts, maybe a couple of sprints to get your body going. This will be highly individual though and you might test out a few different routines until you get the one that works best for you!

Drinking fluids will be important &, depending on how well you've fuelled before, you might consider some carbohydrates in your bottle.

steps.name: Hard
steps.notes: Go, go, go!!!

steps.name: Easy
steps.notes: Aaaand... relax. Try to keep your cadence higher here as it will promote recovery.

steps.name: Hard
steps.notes: GO, GO, GO...!

steps.name: Easy
steps.notes: Again, time to relax. Have a drink and keep those legs spinning!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Last effort of the day! It will be hard, but you can make it!

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.notes: Congrats!! You have completed part one of "I Hate Pav" Intervals :)

title: Shorter Zone 3 + FTP - Session 1
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to develop aerobic endurance in a shorter time period

10 min warm-up

30 min 80% FTP, 5 min 95% FTP, 15 min 55% FTP. RPM should remain constant throughout at +5 on average from previous FTP test. RPE will be high but this is an achievable session.

10 min cool-down

Checkout Pav Bryan's Ultimate Ride Fuel Guide for some help on how to fuel for this: https://spokes.fit/nutrition/pav-bryans-ultimate-ride-fuel-guide/

steps.name: Warm up
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes session! 

This is a moderate intensity session. You might find greater adaptation from this over very low intensity training, should you have limited time. Remember to keep hydrated, you might want to fuel well for this - it is a good opportunity to practise your ride nutrition plan.

steps.name: Hard
steps.notes: Let's get going! Try to keep as steady as possible.

steps.name: Harder
steps.notes: Now a short period at just below threshold - shouldn't be too hard for you!

steps.name: Easy
steps.notes: Relax!

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.notes: Well done!! You have completed part one of this Spokes Z3 + FTP Series :)

title: Zone 3 Steady - 40' - Optional Virtual Group Ride
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to develop aerobic endurance in a shorter time period

10 min warm-up

20 min 80% of FTP/HR) RPM +5 on previous FTP/HR test. RPE 6-7.

10 min cool-down

Here's a Spokes guide on motivation & positive mental attitude, this should help get you through these types of sessions: https://spokes.fit/mental-fitness/motivation-positive-mental-attitude/
coachComments: Option to join a virtual group ride here instead (don't do both!). Try to match the intensity and duration today.

steps.name: Warm up
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes session! 

This is a moderate intensity session. You might find greater adaptation from this over very low intensity training, should you have limited time. Remember to keep hydrated.

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Steady now - nothing too major today - it is ok to finish feeling reasonably good!

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.notes: Well done!! You have completed this Spokes Z3 session :)

title: Recovery - Leg Speed Session 1
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to increase your leg speed, increase your efficiency and, if performed correctly, this will help with recovery

5 min WU

5 min easy gear, low effort, this is about controlled cadence. You can use the rate at which you started bouncing on the saddle less 10. Split with 5 min normal relaxed pedalling. Repeat until time to CD

5 min CD

Here's a guide on improving pedalling efficiency: https://spokes.fit/training/how-to-pedal-efficiently/

steps.name: Warm up
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes session! 

This is a short and easy recovery session, but let's do a brief warm-up to ensure your body is ready!

steps.name: Hard
steps.notes: Keep the power low, but spin your legs faster - reduce slightly if you start bouncing on the saddle

steps.name: Easy
steps.notes: Relax :)

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.notes: Well done!! You have completed part one of the Spokes Leg Speed Series :)

title: Pilates, Yoga or Core (Pav Bryan's S&C YouTube Video) (45 min Session)
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to develop core strength & flexibility, which will increase power output & comfort on the bike

An excellent opportunity to add in some off the bike core, flexibility and stability work

Where possible seek professional guidance or join a class for motivation.

Check out this video for ideas: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yKkbdbzshc8

title: 2x 10' FTP / Zone 2
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to increase your threshold power

20 minute warm-up

10 minute FTP, TT/Race/Preferred cadence, RPE 7-8

10 minute Zone 2, TT cadence, RPE 3-4

10 minute FTP, TT/Race/Preferred cadence, RPE
7-8

20 minute cool-down

Check out this blog on how to improve your FTP: https://spokes.fit/training/how-to-boost-your-ftp/

steps.name: Warm up
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes session! 

This session is designed to improve your Functional Threshold Power (FTP). Ensure you are adequately hydrated for this and consider eating from your nutritional strategy (it's a good time to practise!).

Make the most of this warm-up. You might want to add some higher intensity efforts, maybe a couple of sprints to get your body going. This will be highly individual though and you might test out a few different routines until you get the one that works best for you!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: On the power - keep it steady!!

steps.name: Recovery
steps.notes: It's easier, but keep the power on.

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Last push - you can do it!!

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.notes: Well done!! You have completed this Spokes FTP session :)

title: Two Hours Base Zone 1-2 - Optional Virtual Group Ride
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to improve fat metabolism in your body

No warm-up or cool-down. Stay in Zones 1-2, RPE 2-3 or below, cadence high

Aim for no food during & only electrolyte drink

Check out the Spokes Base Miles Guide for how to make the most of these low intensity rides: https://spokes.fit/technique-tactics/how-to-get-the-most-from-base-rides/
coachComments: Option to join a virtual group ride here instead (don't do both!). Try to match the intensity and duration today.

steps.name: Active
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes session! 

This is a low intensity session. You should remember to keep hydrated, but eating might be limited to really promote fat adaptation. You could do this fasted, but build into this rather than jumping in with a longer session!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Steady now, this is where the greatest adaptation will be found!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Well done!! You've completed this Spokes low intensity session :)

title: Rest Day - Stretching & Foam Roller Only (Pav Bryan's Stretching Video)
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to allow the body to recover from training

Focus on:

Hydration, feeding, stretching, foam roller, et al. Feel free to follow this stretching video -> (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=spB4VwprTIw)

title: "I Hate Pav" Intervals - Session 2
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to improve maximal power output, mainly targeting the anaerobic system

20 minute warm-up

6x (15 sec hard 45 sec zone 2 or 75% FTP)
4x (1 min hard 2 min zone 2 or 75% FTP)
1x (10 min FTP)

During the hard part your RPE should be 8 or above, max means maximum sustainable for the time, use workout builder as a guide only. Cadence of a normal amount so gear appropriately. During the recovery parts reduce all resistance and spin legs. Don’t worry about Zones during this session.

12 minute cool-down

Here's a Spokes guide on building mental toughness: https://spokes.fit/mental-fitness/be-stronger-mentally/

This will be highly individual though and you might test out a few different routines until you get the one that works best for you!

Drinking fluids will be important &, depending on how well you've fuelled before, you might consider some carbohydrates in your bottle.

steps.name: Hard
steps.notes: Go, go, go!!!

steps.name: Easy
steps.notes: Aaaand... relax. Try to keep your cadence higher here as it will promote recovery.

steps.name: Hard
steps.notes: GO, GO, GO...!

steps.name: Easy

steps.notes: Last effort of the day! It will be hard, but you can make it!

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.notes: Congrats!! You have completed part two of "I Hate Pav" Intervals :)

title: Recovery - Leg Speed Session 2
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to increase your leg speed, increase your efficiency and, if performed correctly, this will help with recovery

5 min WU

10 min easy gear, low effort, this is about controlled cadence. You can use the rate at which you started bouncing on the saddle less 10. Split with 5 min normal relaxed pedalling. Repeat once,

5 min CD

Here's a guide on improving pedalling efficiency: https://spokes.fit/training/how-to-pedal-efficiently/

steps.name: Warm up
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes session! 

This is a short and easy recovery session, but let's do a brief warm-up to ensure your body is ready!

steps.name: Hard
steps.notes: Get those legs spinning!! Remember to keep the power low and drop your cadence if you notice any bouncing on the saddle.

steps.name: Easy
steps.notes: Relax!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Last push! Remember power low and cadence high - reduce your leg speed if you notice bouncing or upper body movement.

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.notes: Well done!! You have completed part two of the Spokes Leg Speed Series :)

title: Pilates, Yoga or Core (Pav Bryan's S&C YouTube Video) (45 min Session)
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to develop core strength & flexibility, which will increase power output & comfort on the bike

An excellent opportunity to add in some off the bike core, flexibility and stability work

Where possible seek professional guidance or join a class for motivation.

Check out this video for ideas: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yKkbdbzshc8

title: Hard Ride inc 2x 10' FTP
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to increase your threshold power

20 min WU

Aim for around Z3 average with an addition of 2x 10' FTP split however you like. Keep your cadence high throughout

20 min CD

Check out this blog on how to improve your FTP: https://spokes.fit/training/how-to-boost-your-ftp/

steps.name: Warm up
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes session! 

This session is designed to improve your Functional Threshold Power (FTP). Ensure you are adequately hydrated for this and consider eating from your nutritional strategy (it's a good time to practise!).

Make the most of this warm-up. You might want to add some higher intensity efforts, maybe a couple of sprints to get your body going. This will be highly individual though and you might test out a few different routines until you get the one that works best for you!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Steady paced and keep it conservative - you will want your power available for the harder parts!

steps.name: FTP
steps.notes: On the power, but keep it steady, this is a long session!!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Steady paced and keep it conservative - you will want your power available for the harder parts!

steps.name: FTP
steps.notes: Last push, you can empty the tank at the end!!

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.notes: Well done!! You have completed this Spokes FTP session :)

title: "I Hate Pav" Intervals - Session 3
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to improve maximal power output, mainly targeting the anaerobic system

20 minute warm-up

4x (45 sec hard 15 sec zone 2 or 75% FTP)
2x (1 min zone 2 or 75% FTP 2 min hard)
1x (20 min 93% FTP)

During the hard part your RPE should be 8 or above, max means maximum sustainable for the time, use workout builder as a guide only. Cadence of a normal amount so gear appropriately. During the recovery parts reduce all resistance and spin legs. Don’t worry about Zones during this session.

10 minute cool-down

Here's a Spokes guide on building mental toughness: https://spokes.fit/mental-fitness/be-stronger-mentally/

steps.name: Warm up
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes session! 

This is an intense session, make sure you make the most of this warm-up. You might want to add some higher intensity efforts, maybe a couple of sprints to get your body going. This will be highly individual though and you might test out a few different routines until you get the one that works best for you!

Drinking fluids will be important &, depending on how well you've fuelled before, you might consider some carbohydrates in your bottle.

steps.name: Hard
steps.notes: Go, go, go!!!

steps.name: Easy
steps.notes: Aaaand... relax. Try to keep your cadence higher here as it will promote recovery.

steps.name: Easy
steps.notes: It's almost time, make sure you take on fluids, carbs now...

steps.name: Hard
steps.notes: GO, GO, GO...!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Last effort of the day! It's a big one, but you can push through this!

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.notes:
Congrats!! You have completed part three of "I Hate Pav" Intervals - well done on smashing this series!!

The big question is, do you hate me?

Pav

The Goal Of This Session: is to develop aerobic endurance in a shorter time period

10 min warm-up

title: Recovery - Leg Speed Session 3
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to increase your leg speed, increase your efficiency and, if performed correctly, this will help with recovery

5 min WU

15 min at RPM +20 on last average from FTP test, followed by 5 min easy spin. Easy gear so low effort, this is about controlled cadence. You can also use the rate at which you started bouncing on the saddle less 10.

10 min CD

Here's a guide on improving pedalling efficiency: https://spokes.fit/training/how-to-pedal-efficiently/

steps.name: Warm up
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes session! 

This is a short and easy recovery session, but let's do a brief warm-up to ensure your body is ready!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Let's get those legs spinning!! Keep power low and drop your cadence if you notice any bouncing on the saddle.

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.notes: Well done!! You have completed part three & the Spokes Leg Speed Series :)

title: Pilates, Yoga or Core (Pav Bryan's S&C YouTube Video) (45 min Session)
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to develop core strength & flexibility, which will increase power output & comfort on the bike

An excellent opportunity to add in some off the bike core, flexibility and stability work

Where possible seek professional guidance or join a class for motivation.

Check out this video for ideas: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yKkbdbzshc8

title: Threshold Efforts
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to increase your threshold power

10 min warm-up.

10 min 83% FTP
5 min easy spin
2x (5 min 98% FTP 1 min easy)
4 min easy
3x (2 min 115% FTP 30 sec easy)
4.5 min easy
6x (1 min 120% FTP 30 sec easy)

Keep cadence high throughout

8 min cool-down.

Check out this blog on how to improve your FTP: https://spokes.fit/training/how-to-boost-your-ftp/

steps.name: Warm up
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes session! 

This session is designed to improve your Functional Threshold Power (FTP). Ensure you are adequately hydrated for this and consider eating from your nutritional strategy (it's a good time to practise!).

Make the most of this warm-up. You might want to add some higher intensity efforts, maybe a couple of sprints to get your body going. This will be highly individual though and you might test out a few different routines until you get the one that works best for you!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: It starts easy, but don't worry, it'll get harder!!

steps.name: Recovery
steps.notes: Relax!

steps.name: Hard
steps.notes: Go, go, go!!

steps.name: Easy
steps.notes: Relax, but not for long...

steps.name: Recovery
steps.notes: Grab a drink, take on food if you need it and refocus for the next set!

steps.name: Hard
steps.notes: Go!!

steps.name: Easy
steps.notes: Quick break, don't lose focus!

steps.name: Recovery
steps.notes: Again, time to refocus your mind, grab a drink, whatever you need!

steps.name: Hard
steps.notes: Let's finish this!!

steps.name: Easy
steps.notes: Recover!!

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.notes: Well done!! You have completed this Spokes FTP session :)

title: Recovery Ride
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to promote the recovery process

No warm-up or cool-down required due to low intensity

Strictly recovery zone only, RPE 1, cadence high, loosen those legs!

Checkout this guide on improving your recovery: https://spokes.fit/technique-tactics/how-to-improve-your-recovery/

steps.name: Active
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes recovery session!!

Remember to take it easy, anything too intense will ultimately hinder your recovery.

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Remember to drink lots of fluids today!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Ensure you get enough micro-nutrients in your body - these are commonly found in plants and grains.

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Be recovery focused! What could you do in your day to improve your recovery?

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Remember to stretch, foam roll or use a percussion recovery device to help you recover faster.

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Well done! You're nearly finished - remember to stay recovery focused and you will be flying next time you get on the bike!

title: Ramp Test
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to set a benchmark or check progress against a previous score

20 min warm-up.

This is 10 minutes of ramping up, in 1' intervals, until exhaustion.

70% of the average from your final completed minute is your approximate FTP.

20 min cool-down.

Something to help with preparing mentally for this test: https://spokes.fit/category/mental-fitness/

How did you do? Let us know via social media:

facebook.com/spokesfit
instagram.com/spokesfit
twitter.com/spokesfit

steps.name: Warm up
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes test! 

This is an intense test, make sure you make the most of this warm-up. You might want to add some higher intensity efforts, maybe a couple of sprints to get your body going. This will be highly individual though and you might test out a few different routines until you get the one that works best for you!

Get in the right mindset and let's smash this!!
Start at a power that you can progress for about 10' - if you've never done a ramp test, follow the power targets!
+25 watts
+25 watts
+25 watts - you've got this!!
+25 watts
+25 watts
+25 watts
+25 watts - dig deep now, you're nearly done!!
+25 watts - so close, keep it going!!
+25 watts and finish strong!!

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.notes: Well done on completing this Spokes test!

title: Two Hours Base Zone 1-2 - Optional Virtual Group Ride
description:
The Goal Of This Session: is to improve fat metabolism in your body

No warm-up or cool-down. Stay in Zones 1-2, RPE 2-3 or below, cadence high

Aim for no food during & only electrolyte drink

Check out the Spokes Base Miles Guide for how to make the most of these low intensity rides: https://spokes.fit/technique-tactics/how-to-get-the-most-from-base-rides/
coachComments: Option to join a virtual group ride here instead (don't do both!). Try to match the intensity and duration today.

steps.name: Active
steps.notes:
Welcome to this Spokes session! 

This is a low intensity session. You should remember to keep hydrated, but eating might be limited to really promote fat adaptation. You could do this fasted, but build into this rather than jumping in with a longer session!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Steady now, this is where the greatest adaptation will be found!

steps.name: Active
steps.notes: Well done!! You've completed this Spokes low intensity session :)

title: Link to $50.00 Vouchers Inside.
description:
Many thanks for your purchase! Here is a very short questionnaire and, at the end, you will receive a code to receive $50.00 off selected Spokes services.

Link to get $50.00 voucher -> https://spokes.typeform.com/to/qu6DFM

Spokes store -> https://spokes.fit/shop/
